text.section: An authority shall pay the principal of and interest on its bonds only from the funds from which this subtitle authorizes payment.

For any bond that an authority issues, the authority:
Shall place the date of issue on the bond;
Shall set the maturity date for the bond, which shall be any time up to 40 years from the date of issue; and
May provide for the redemption of the bond before maturity:
At the option of the authority; and
At a price and on terms and conditions that the authority fixes before it issues the bond.

A bond or certificate that otherwise conforms to this section is valid and sufficient for all purposes whether or not the officer whose signature or a facsimile of whose signature is on the bond or certificate is still an officer when the bond or certificate is delivered.

An authority:
Shall determine the form of its bonds; and
May issue its bonds in coupon or registered form or both.

An authority shall determine:
The manner of execution of its bonds;
The denominations of its bonds; and
The places for payment of the principal of and interest on its bonds, which may be any bank or trust company.
A bond issued under this subtitle is fully negotiable as provided in Title 8 of the Commercial Law Article.

An authority may provide for:
The registration of any coupon bond as to:
Principal only; or
Both principal and interest; and
The reconversion into a coupon bond of any bond that is registered as to both principal and interest.
